texts.label: text
texts.orig: We acknowledge the land of our projects that contractors and unions alike work on in the Province of Alberta  is  the  traditional  and  ancestral  territory  of  many  Indigenous  peoples,  presently  subject  to Treaties 4, 6, 7, 8 and 10. Namely: the Blackfoot Confederacy - Kainai, Piikani, and Siksika - the Cree, Dene, Saulteaux, Nakota Sioux, Stoney Nakoda, and the Tsuu T'ina Nation and the Métis People of Alberta. This includes the Métis Settlements and the Six Regions of the Métis Nation of Alberta within the historical Northwest Métis Homeland. We acknowledge the many First Nations, Métis and Inuit who  have  lived  in  and  cared  for  these  lands  for  generations.  We  are  grateful  for  the  traditional Knowledge Keepers and Elders who are still with us today and those who have gone before us. We make this acknowledgment as an act of reconciliation and gratitude to those whose territory we work in, reside on or are visiting.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: When craft  personnel  requisitions  are  received  by  the  union  at  least  thirty  (30)  days  prior  to  the effective start date, any member Union which cannot supply qualified workers within seven (7) days prior to the start date requested, (Saturday, Sunday and holidays excluded), then the Company may secure  other  qualified  workers.  Any  other  qualified  workers  secured  by  the  Employer  must  be appropriately dispatched by the local union.
texts.text: When craft  personnel  requisitions  are  received  by  the  union  at  least  thirty  (30)  days  prior  to  the effective start date, any member Union which cannot supply qualified workers within seven (7) days prior to the start date requested, (Saturday, Sunday and holidays excluded), then the Company may secure  other  qualified  workers.  Any  other  qualified  workers  secured  by  the  Employer  must  be appropriately dispatched by the local union.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 3.301 Craft Requisitions Received Less Than Thirty (30) Days Prior to Start Date
texts.text: 3.301 Craft Requisitions Received Less Than Thirty (30) Days Prior to Start Date

texts.label: text
texts.orig: When any Member Union cannot supply qualified workers within forty-eight (48) hours of the start date, (Saturday, Sunday and holidays excluded), then the Company may secure other qualified workers. The Company may immediately put them to work with direction to the workers that they are employed subject  to  Union  agreement  of  membership  and/or  replacement  by  Union  members  and  advise forthwith the appropriate Business Agent that the workers are on the job.

texts.orig: ARTICLE 4.000 SCOPE OF WORK
texts.text: ARTICLE 4.000 SCOPE OF WORK

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4.100 The scope of this Agreement covers all work of a maintenance nature (as defined in Article 5) assigned by  the  Owner  to  the  Company  and  performed  by  the  employees  of  the  Company  covered  by  this Agreement.
texts.text: 4.100 The scope of this Agreement covers all work of a maintenance nature (as defined in Article 5) assigned by  the  Owner  to  the  Company  and  performed  by  the  employees  of  the  Company  covered  by  this Agreement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4.200 The scope of this Agreement does not cover work performed by the Company of a new construction nature  which  is  work  required  to  erect  new  facilities  in  which  event,  the  work  shall  be  done  in accordance with existing building construction agreements.
texts.text: 4.200 The scope of this Agreement does not cover work performed by the Company of a new construction nature  which  is  work  required  to  erect  new  facilities  in  which  event,  the  work  shall  be  done  in accordance with existing building construction agreements.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ARTICLE 5.000 DEFINITIONS
texts.text: ARTICLE 5.000 DEFINITIONS

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5.100 All work performed by the Company on existing equipment and machinery, including all associated work in a given plant, shall be maintenance. This shall include replacement of existing individual items of machinery and equipment with new units, including all associated work. It is understood that this concept would not include replacement of an entire process system installation in a facility in order to increase production.
texts.text: 5.100 All work performed by the Company on existing equipment and machinery, including all associated work in a given plant, shall be maintenance. This shall include replacement of existing individual items of machinery and equipment with new units, including all associated work. It is understood that this concept would not include replacement of an entire process system installation in a facility in order to increase production.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ARTICLE 6.000 GRIEVANCE PROCEDURE
texts.text: ARTICLE 6.000 GRIEVANCE PROCEDURE

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6.100 It  is  agreed  that  it  is  the  spirit  and  intent  of  this  agreement  to  address  grievances  promptly.  All grievances, but not those pertaining to jurisdictional disputes, covering the interpretation, application, operation, terminations, or alleged violation of this collective agreement that may arise on any work covered by this agreement must be initiated in writing within ten (10) calendar days of the incident and shall be handled in the following manner. It is also agreed that if the grievance is to be rectified or abandoned  at  Step  1-3  that  the  appropriate  union  representative  provides  written  notification  of settlement of issue.
texts.text: 6.100 It  is  agreed  that  it  is  the  spirit  and  intent  of  this  agreement  to  address  grievances  promptly.  All grievances, but not those pertaining to jurisdictional disputes, covering the interpretation, application, operation, terminations, or alleged violation of this collective agreement that may arise on any work covered by this agreement must be initiated in writing within ten (10) calendar days of the incident and shall be handled in the following manner. It is also agreed that if the grievance is to be rectified or abandoned  at  Step  1-3  that  the  appropriate  union  representative  provides  written  notification  of settlement of issue.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6.101 Step I Between the aggrieved Employee/Craft Steward and the Employer foreperson/supervisor.
texts.text: 6.101 Step I Between the aggrieved Employee/Craft Steward and the Employer foreperson/supervisor.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A standard GPMC / NMC grievance form must be filled out by the Craft Steward/ Employer at this step. Grievance forms will be provided by the Company at the jobsite, or they may be downloaded from the General Presidents' Maintenance Committee website at www.gpmccanada.com
texts.text: A standard GPMC / NMC grievance form must be filled out by the Craft Steward/ Employer at this step. Grievance forms will be provided by the Company at the jobsite, or they may be downloaded from the General Presidents' Maintenance Committee website at www.gpmccanada.com

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If the grievance is not settled within seven (7) calendar days, then the grievance may be advanced to Step II.  Written notice must be provided within seven (7) calendar days when advancing to the next step.
texts.text: If the grievance is not settled within seven (7) calendar days, then the grievance may be advanced to Step II.  Written notice must be provided within seven (7) calendar days when advancing to the next step.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6.102 Step II Between the aggrieved employee, the Craft Steward and/or local union business representative and the foreperson, the supervisor, and the project manager.
texts.text: 6.102 Step II Between the aggrieved employee, the Craft Steward and/or local union business representative and the foreperson, the supervisor, and the project manager.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If settlement is not achieved within seven (7) calendar days at Step II, the grievance may be advanced  to Step III. Written notice must  be  provided to the International  Union Representative and the Employer Representative when advancing to the next step.
texts.text: If settlement is not achieved within seven (7) calendar days at Step II, the grievance may be advanced  to Step III. Written notice must  be  provided to the International  Union Representative and the Employer Representative when advancing to the next step.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Timelines may be extended upon written agreement by both parties.
texts.text: Timelines may be extended upon written agreement by both parties.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6.104 Step IV The  GPMC/NMC  Labour  Relations  Representative  and  the  AMCC  Representative  shall establish  a  Grievance  Panel  consisting  of  two  (2)  Committee  Representatives  and  one  (1) AMCC Employer Representative within fourteen (14) calendar days of notification, either at a mutually agreed to location or via electronic platform to hear the grievance. The GPMC/NMC appoint one of the three (3) panelists to act as the Chairperson for the hearing.
texts.text: 6.104 Step IV The  GPMC/NMC  Labour  Relations  Representative  and  the  AMCC  Representative  shall establish  a  Grievance  Panel  consisting  of  two  (2)  Committee  Representatives  and  one  (1) AMCC Employer Representative within fourteen (14) calendar days of notification, either at a mutually agreed to location or via electronic platform to hear the grievance. The GPMC/NMC appoint one of the three (3) panelists to act as the Chairperson for the hearing.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Submissions from both the Union and the Employer to the grievance panel must include a copy  of  the  grievance  form,  as  indicated  in  7.101,  names  of  all  grievors  affected  by  the grievance  and  any  other  relevant  information  or  documents  pertaining  to  the  grievance. Please note that the remedy requested by either party must clearly be identified in writing on the grievance form.
texts.text: Submissions from both the Union and the Employer to the grievance panel must include a copy  of  the  grievance  form,  as  indicated  in  7.101,  names  of  all  grievors  affected  by  the grievance  and  any  other  relevant  information  or  documents  pertaining  to  the  grievance. Please note that the remedy requested by either party must clearly be identified in writing on the grievance form.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: All submissions shall be received by the Labour Relations Representative no later than three (3) calendar days prior to the scheduled hearing date.
texts.text: All submissions shall be received by the Labour Relations Representative no later than three (3) calendar days prior to the scheduled hearing date.

texts.text: If  either  party  to  the  grievance  does  not  accept  the  Grievance  Panel's  decision,  they  may advance the grievance to Step V upon written notification to the affected Party.

texts.text: 6.105 Step V If  any  dispute  or  grievance  concerning  the  interpretation,  application  or  violation  of  this agreement cannot be settled through the procedure described above, the matter may be submitted  by  the  Union  or  the  Employer  to  arbitration  for  adjudication  within  ten  (10) calendar days.

texts.orig: 8.100 A Steward shall be a qualified worker appointed by a Member Union and confirmed in writing to the Company when designated as a Steward and also when ceasing to act as Steward. Duties shall be to deal with grievances and such matters normally handled by a Union Steward subject to the terms of this  Agreement.  When  employees  are  laid-off,  the  Steward  shall  receive  a  copy  of  the  lay-off  list immediately prior to the Company advising the affected employees.

texts.text: 11.300 On maintenance, the overriding factor is harmonizing statutory holidays with in-plant workers. Should the Owner determine another day be recognized for its people, this day will be recognized by Company forces.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The intent of the harmonization principle of the Statutory Holiday between the Client in-plant forces and  those  working  under  the  GPMA/NMA  Agreements  allows  for  the  alignment  for  all  personnel working  at  a  particular  site  to  observe  the  same  designated  day  in  order  to  accommodate  the operational requirements of the facility. A Client/in-plant union merely moving the Statutory Holiday for its in-plant personnel does not trigger the harmonization provision contained within the Collective Agreement. The day of observance for the Holiday remains as identified, unless direction has been given  by  the  Client  requesting  for  our  employers  to  observe  it  at  the  same  time  as  the  in-plant personnel.
texts.text: The intent of the harmonization principle of the Statutory Holiday between the Client in-plant forces and  those  working  under  the  GPMA/NMA  Agreements  allows  for  the  alignment  for  all  personnel working  at  a  particular  site  to  observe  the  same  designated  day  in  order  to  accommodate  the operational requirements of the facility. A Client/in-plant union merely moving the Statutory Holiday for its in-plant personnel does not trigger the harmonization provision contained within the Collective Agreement. The day of observance for the Holiday remains as identified, unless direction has been given  by  the  Client  requesting  for  our  employers  to  observe  it  at  the  same  time  as  the  in-plant personnel.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In  order for the harmonization principle to be applicable, the Contractor must notify the GPMC in advance of the pending movement of the Holiday along with the designated day for observance. The designated day to for observance must be applicable to all contractors and all trades across the entire facility.
texts.text: In  order for the harmonization principle to be applicable, the Contractor must notify the GPMC in advance of the pending movement of the Holiday along with the designated day for observance. The designated day to for observance must be applicable to all contractors and all trades across the entire facility.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Employers will post the date to be observed no later than seven (7) days prior to the holiday.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In the absence of meeting the above and providing proper notification, the holiday will be observed in accordance with the provisions outlined in Article 12.000.

texts.orig: 12.100 When an employee reports for work, unless previously advised there is no work available, they shall be entitled to two (2) hours pay at the appropriate day or shift rate. Should the employee start work or be required to wait at the jobsite, they shall be paid for hours worked or actual waiting time past the two (2) hours minimum.
texts.text: 12.100 When an employee reports for work, unless previously advised there is no work available, they shall be entitled to two (2) hours pay at the appropriate day or shift rate. Should the employee start work or be required to wait at the jobsite, they shall be paid for hours worked or actual waiting time past the two (2) hours minimum.

texts.text: 13.100 a) Daily Travel: On those projects that are located between forty-five (45) radius kilometers to one hundred and twenty (120) radius kilometers from Edmonton and/or Calgary City Hall(s) or other Hiring Hall locations, the Company shall supply suitable transportation to and from the project and mutually agreed to pick-up points.

texts.label: text

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 14.100 It is agreed that all employees covered by this agreement are to receive two (2) rest or coffee breaks of ten (10) minutes on the job in the area or areas designated by the Company. Each break shall be established by the Employer in each eight (8) hour shift. It is, however, understood that this shall be done in such a manner as to not stop the necessary operation of the job.
texts.text: 14.100 It is agreed that all employees covered by this agreement are to receive two (2) rest or coffee breaks of ten (10) minutes on the job in the area or areas designated by the Company. Each break shall be established by the Employer in each eight (8) hour shift. It is, however, understood that this shall be done in such a manner as to not stop the necessary operation of the job.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Where a scheduled ten (10) hour day is established the rest or coffee breaks will be two (2) breaks of fifteen (15) minutes each.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 15.100 Eight (8) hours per day shall constitute a day's work and forty (40) hours per week, Monday to Friday inclusive, shall constitute a week's work. The regular starting time shall be eight (8) o'clock a.m., and the regular quitting time shall be four-thirty (4:30) o'clock p.m. Start times may be staggered two (2) hours between 7:00 a.m. and 9:00 a.m. as job conditions warrant.
texts.text: 15.100 Eight (8) hours per day shall constitute a day's work and forty (40) hours per week, Monday to Friday inclusive, shall constitute a week's work. The regular starting time shall be eight (8) o'clock a.m., and the regular quitting time shall be four-thirty (4:30) o'clock p.m. Start times may be staggered two (2) hours between 7:00 a.m. and 9:00 a.m. as job conditions warrant.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: As an option, ten (10) hours per day, Monday to Thursday or Tuesday to Friday may be worked at straight time. The ten (10) hour system must operate for a minimum period of four (4) consecutive days before it is established as the regular hours of work. Once established it becomes the regular hours of work for those so assigned.
texts.text: As an option, ten (10) hours per day, Monday to Thursday or Tuesday to Friday may be worked at straight time. The ten (10) hour system must operate for a minimum period of four (4) consecutive days before it is established as the regular hours of work. Once established it becomes the regular hours of work for those so assigned.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: When establishing a four (4) day ten (10) hour work week, the Employer will advise the affected Local Union office that a four (4) day ten (10) hour option is in place and declare if it is a Monday to Thursday, or Tuesday to Friday work pattern.

texts.text: 15.800 Employees called out between regular shifts will be entitled to a minimum of two (2) hours pay at double (2x) the straight time total package hourly rate.

texts.text: All hours worked beyond the minimum two (2) hour threshold will be paid at double (2x) the straight time total package hourly rate.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 15.900 It is not intended that an employee shall work more than sixteen (16) hours in any given twenty-four (24) hour period therefore it is established that the employee must have eight (8) continuous hours off between regular shifts or they will be paid overtime rates for all hours worked in excess of the first eight (8) until such times as they have eight (8) continuous hours off.
texts.text: 15.900 It is not intended that an employee shall work more than sixteen (16) hours in any given twenty-four (24) hour period therefore it is established that the employee must have eight (8) continuous hours off between regular shifts or they will be paid overtime rates for all hours worked in excess of the first eight (8) until such times as they have eight (8) continuous hours off.

texts.label: text

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ARTICLE 16.000 SAFETY
texts.text: ARTICLE 16.000 SAFETY

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 16.100 The Employees covered by the terms of this Agreement shall at all times while in the employ of the Company  be  bound  by  the  safety  rules  and  regulations  as  established  by  the  Owner,  Company, applicable Council Member Labour Agreement and applicable Provincial or Federal Regulations, Acts and Laws.
texts.text: 16.100 The Employees covered by the terms of this Agreement shall at all times while in the employ of the Company  be  bound  by  the  safety  rules  and  regulations  as  established  by  the  Owner,  Company, applicable Council Member Labour Agreement and applicable Provincial or Federal Regulations, Acts and Laws.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 16.200 The Company will provide to the employees, such items of safety equipment as required by these Safety Rules and Regulations. The Company accepts responsibility to provide coveralls and all necessary protective clothing required for working conditions which are exceptional or would lead to speedier deterioration of personal clothing, than under normal or usually accepted working conditions.
texts.text: 16.200 The Company will provide to the employees, such items of safety equipment as required by these Safety Rules and Regulations. The Company accepts responsibility to provide coveralls and all necessary protective clothing required for working conditions which are exceptional or would lead to speedier deterioration of personal clothing, than under normal or usually accepted working conditions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 16.300 The Company will provide a separate area for employees to remove and store coveralls, work clothing etc., prior to entering lunchrooms.
texts.text: 16.300 The Company will provide a separate area for employees to remove and store coveralls, work clothing etc., prior to entering lunchrooms.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 16.400 All Employers signatory to this agreement commit to support the Canadian Safety Achievement Awards (CS2A) program through the submission of nominations annually.
texts.text: 16.400 All Employers signatory to this agreement commit to support the Canadian Safety Achievement Awards (CS2A) program through the submission of nominations annually.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ARTICLE 17.000 APPRENTICES
texts.text: ARTICLE 17.000 APPRENTICES

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 17.100 The Council and Member Unions agree that the needs of plant maintenance may warrant differing apprentice ratios than those established. The Company and the Council Affiliates, therefore, agree to negotiate such ratios from time to time as the conditions warrant.
texts.text: 17.100 The Council and Member Unions agree that the needs of plant maintenance may warrant differing apprentice ratios than those established. The Company and the Council Affiliates, therefore, agree to negotiate such ratios from time to time as the conditions warrant.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 17.200 The Parties to this Agreement recognize the importance of apprenticeship to the maintenance industry. The  Parties  agree  to  support,  the  employment  of  apprentices  on  maintenance  projects  to  reflect acceptable reference agreement ratios. The Company will set a target to employ a minimum of 25% apprentices  (distributed  evenly  between  the  applicable  levels  of  each  trade)  of  the  number  of Journeypersons  on  the  project  (with  30%  identified  apprenticeship),  unless  varied  by  mutual agreement between the Company and Union as job conditions warrant.
texts.text: 17.200 The Parties to this Agreement recognize the importance of apprenticeship to the maintenance industry. The  Parties  agree  to  support,  the  employment  of  apprentices  on  maintenance  projects  to  reflect acceptable reference agreement ratios. The Company will set a target to employ a minimum of 25% apprentices  (distributed  evenly  between  the  applicable  levels  of  each  trade)  of  the  number  of Journeypersons  on  the  project  (with  30%  identified  apprenticeship),  unless  varied  by  mutual agreement between the Company and Union as job conditions warrant.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Parties further agree that they will work together to maximize opportunities for local residents to participate in apprenticeship and to maximize opportunities for other underrepresented groups.
texts.text: The Parties further agree that they will work together to maximize opportunities for local residents to participate in apprenticeship and to maximize opportunities for other underrepresented groups.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Employees will be compensated for the prescribed amount of time, at the straight time total package hourly rate, for completing any Owner / Client online orientation, onboarding or basic training courses required of an employee.
texts.text: Employees will be compensated for the prescribed amount of time, at the straight time total package hourly rate, for completing any Owner / Client online orientation, onboarding or basic training courses required of an employee.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Employer will identify the prescribed amount of time required for each course and include this information on the manpower request sent to the Local Union. The prescribed amount of time for each course  shall  also  be  forwarded  to  the  administrative  office  of  the  GPMC  and  the  Maintenance Contractors Association. These Parties will review the documentation to ensure the time allocated is uniform for all Employers.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: 19.200 The designation and determination of the number of forepersons on maintenance work shall be the prerogative of the Company.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  Foreperson  may  be  requested  to  work  with  the  tools,  when  in  the  Company's  opinion,  it  is advisable.
texts.text: The  Foreperson  may  be  requested  to  work  with  the  tools,  when  in  the  Company's  opinion,  it  is advisable.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ARTICLE 20.000 LOCKOUT AND WORK STOPPAGE
texts.text: ARTICLE 20.000 LOCKOUT AND WORK STOPPAGE

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 20.100 There shall be no lockout by the Company, and no work stoppages by the Union.
texts.text: 20.100 There shall be no lockout by the Company, and no work stoppages by the Union.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 20.200 In  the  event  that  local  agreements  terminate  and  no  agreement  is  reached  regarding  wages,  the Company, in order that continuity of work shall be maintained agrees as follows:
texts.text: 20.200 In  the  event  that  local  agreements  terminate  and  no  agreement  is  reached  regarding  wages,  the Company, in order that continuity of work shall be maintained agrees as follows:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 20.201 Should a work stoppage occur in negotiating the local agreement, the employees of the affected Unions will be paid the appropriately adjusted wage rate and benefits negotiated in the new agreement, on a retroactive basis to the date of the work stoppage or the effective date of the new wage rate whichever is the earlier.
texts.text: 20.201 Should a work stoppage occur in negotiating the local agreement, the employees of the affected Unions will be paid the appropriately adjusted wage rate and benefits negotiated in the new agreement, on a retroactive basis to the date of the work stoppage or the effective date of the new wage rate whichever is the earlier.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 20.202 Should no work stoppage occur in negotiating the local agreement, the employees of the affected Unions will be paid the appropriately adjusted minimum wage rate and benefits negotiated in the new agreement on the effective date of the new wage rate. This is to ensure against any work stoppage on this project which would be caused by a breakdown of local negotiations.
texts.text: 20.202 Should no work stoppage occur in negotiating the local agreement, the employees of the affected Unions will be paid the appropriately adjusted minimum wage rate and benefits negotiated in the new agreement on the effective date of the new wage rate. This is to ensure against any work stoppage on this project which would be caused by a breakdown of local negotiations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 20.300 It is agreed the work force in effect on any site will not be employed on work that is affected as a result of a Building Trades construction strike or lockout.
texts.text: 20.300 It is agreed the work force in effect on any site will not be employed on work that is affected as a result of a Building Trades construction strike or lockout.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ARTICLE 21.000 TOOL ROOMS AND TOOLS
texts.text: ARTICLE 21.000 TOOL ROOMS AND TOOLS

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 21.100 Personal Tools
texts.text: 21.100 Personal Tools

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Employee's personal tools shall be in good condition when he/she hires on to a job and they shall be maintained and kept in good condition.
texts.text: The Employee's personal tools shall be in good condition when he/she hires on to a job and they shall be maintained and kept in good condition.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The personal tools shall be those defined within each trades respective reference agreement or as required on the dispatch.
texts.text: The personal tools shall be those defined within each trades respective reference agreement or as required on the dispatch.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 21.200 The Employer shall replace Employee's personal tools when:
texts.text: 21.200 The Employer shall replace Employee's personal tools when:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) Such tools are destroyed by fire on the Employer's premises or in a storage place designated by the Employer.
texts.text: (a) Such tools are destroyed by fire on the Employer's premises or in a storage place designated by the Employer.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) Such tools are lost through theft by forced entry of a designated storage place.
texts.text: (b) Such tools are lost through theft by forced entry of a designated storage place.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) In the course of an Employee's work assignment such tools are damaged beyond repair, provided the Employee satisfies his Employer the damage was not intentional or caused by  the Employee's failure to exercise due care and attention. Normal wear shall not constitute damage.
texts.text: (c) In the course of an Employee's work assignment such tools are damaged beyond repair, provided the Employee satisfies his Employer the damage was not intentional or caused by  the Employee's failure to exercise due care and attention. Normal wear shall not constitute damage.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) The  Employer  shall  provide  lock-fast  facilities  for  storage  of  personal  tools  normally  used  by Employees in the process of their work when such tools are not in use.
texts.text: (d) The  Employer  shall  provide  lock-fast  facilities  for  storage  of  personal  tools  normally  used  by Employees in the process of their work when such tools are not in use.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 21.300 Should an Employee be laid off/terminated on their scheduled days off, rotational leave, approved leave of absence or furlough the Employer shall attempt to contact and notify the Employee of such lay- off/termination using the contact information provided by the Employee to the Employer.
texts.text: 21.300 Should an Employee be laid off/terminated on their scheduled days off, rotational leave, approved leave of absence or furlough the Employer shall attempt to contact and notify the Employee of such lay- off/termination using the contact information provided by the Employee to the Employer.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If  the  Employer  is  successful  in  advising  the  Employee  of  such  a  layoff/termination,  they  shall  be responsible  for  all  costs  associated  with  the  site  packaging  and  transportation  of  the  Employee's personal tools and belongings to the Employee's address or the chosen destination as made by the Employee.
texts.text: If  the  Employer  is  successful  in  advising  the  Employee  of  such  a  layoff/termination,  they  shall  be responsible  for  all  costs  associated  with  the  site  packaging  and  transportation  of  the  Employee's personal tools and belongings to the Employee's address or the chosen destination as made by the Employee.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Employers  will  comply  that  tools  will  be  returned  within  seven  (7)  working  days  of  successfully contacting the Employee for the scheduled shift the Employee was working.
texts.text: Employers  will  comply  that  tools  will  be  returned  within  seven  (7)  working  days  of  successfully contacting the Employee for the scheduled shift the Employee was working.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Employer will be deemed in compliance with this Article upon production of a pre-paid, time stamped waybill verifying shipment of the tools and belongings.
texts.text: The Employer will be deemed in compliance with this Article upon production of a pre-paid, time stamped waybill verifying shipment of the tools and belongings.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ARTICLE 22.000 MANAGEMENT CLAUSE
texts.text: ARTICLE 22.000 MANAGEMENT CLAUSE

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 22.100 The Company shall have full right to direct the progress of the work and to exercise all function and control, including, but not limited to, the selection of the kind of materials, supplies, or equipment used in the prosecution of the work and the right to discharge or lay-off any employee for just and sufficient cause, provided, however, that no Employee shall be discriminated against. These provisions do not prohibit the Union's right to the peaceful exercise of grievance procedure if in its judgment the spirit and intent of this Agreement has been violated.
texts.text: 22.100 The Company shall have full right to direct the progress of the work and to exercise all function and control, including, but not limited to, the selection of the kind of materials, supplies, or equipment used in the prosecution of the work and the right to discharge or lay-off any employee for just and sufficient cause, provided, however, that no Employee shall be discriminated against. These provisions do not prohibit the Union's right to the peaceful exercise of grievance procedure if in its judgment the spirit and intent of this Agreement has been violated.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ARTICLE 23.000 TRADE CO-OPERATION
texts.text: ARTICLE 23.000 TRADE CO-OPERATION

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 23.100 Maintenance conditions do not always justify adherence to craft lines which, in itself, does not establish precedent or change the appropriate jurisdiction of the crafts involved. Composite or mixed crews may be  formed  where  conditions  warrant.  It  is  understood  that  all  employees  will  work  together harmoniously as a group and as directed by the Company.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ARTICLE 24.000 DURATION AND TERMINATION OF AGREEMENT
texts.text: ARTICLE 24.000 DURATION AND TERMINATION OF AGREEMENT

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 24.100 This Agreement shall become effective January 1, 2025, and will remain in full force and effect until December 31, 2028, and from year to year thereafter unless written notice to terminate or modify the Agreement is filed by either party at least sixty (60) days prior to the expiry date.
texts.text: 24.100 This Agreement shall become effective January 1, 2025, and will remain in full force and effect until December 31, 2028, and from year to year thereafter unless written notice to terminate or modify the Agreement is filed by either party at least sixty (60) days prior to the expiry date.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 24.200 Amendments may be made at any time by mutual consent.
texts.text: 24.200 Amendments may be made at any time by mutual consent.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 24.300 The National Maintenance Council may, upon application from Employers, agree to amend portions of this  Agreement in  order  to meet  the  needs  of  specific  projects  or  industry sectors  or  regions.  The Council will establish a Standing Sub-Committee to receive and review such requests.
texts.text: 24.300 The National Maintenance Council may, upon application from Employers, agree to amend portions of this  Agreement in  order  to meet  the  needs  of  specific  projects  or  industry sectors  or  regions.  The Council will establish a Standing Sub-Committee to receive and review such requests.

texts.orig: ARTICLE 25.000 ELECTRONIC SIGNATURE
texts.text: ARTICLE 25.000 ELECTRONIC SIGNATURE

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 25.100 This  collective  agreement  can  be  executed  by  a  representative  of  each  Trade  Union  by  electronic signature  or  other  electronic  means.  A  letter  of  authorization  to  that  effect  is  on  record  with  the National Maintenance Council for Canada. Execution by electronic means has the same effect as if the collective  agreement  was  executed  in  person  by  the  representative  of  the  Trade  Union  physically signing a copy of the collective agreement.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: NATIONAL MAINTENANCE AGREEMENT FOR ALBERTA HOURS OF WORK PROVISIONS,SUNCOR REFINERY, EDMONTON, ALBERTA
texts.text: NATIONAL MAINTENANCE AGREEMENT FOR ALBERTA HOURS OF WORK PROVISIONS,SUNCOR REFINERY, EDMONTON, ALBERTA

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1) COMPRESSED WORK WEEK ARRANGEMENTS
texts.text: 1) COMPRESSED WORK WEEK ARRANGEMENTS

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Parties agree to the following amendment to the National Maintenance Agreement at the  Suncor  Refinery  Site  in  Edmonton,  Alberta  which  "grandfathers"  the  Compressed Work Week arrangements in place at the site. This Compressed Work Week arrangement will  apply  to  Edmonton  Exchanger  and  be  an  option  to  the  existing  hours  of  work arrangements covered in Article 16.000 of the National Maintenance Agreement.
texts.text: The Parties agree to the following amendment to the National Maintenance Agreement at the  Suncor  Refinery  Site  in  Edmonton,  Alberta  which  "grandfathers"  the  Compressed Work Week arrangements in place at the site. This Compressed Work Week arrangement will  apply  to  Edmonton  Exchanger  and  be  an  option  to  the  existing  hours  of  work arrangements covered in Article 16.000 of the National Maintenance Agreement.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This grandfathered Compressed Work Week will follow the existing arrangements on site as described as follows:
texts.text: This grandfathered Compressed Work Week will follow the existing arrangements on site as described as follows:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) The  parties  to  this  Agreement  agree  that  the  maximum  of  nine  (9)  hours  shall constitute  a  normal  days  work  beginning  at  7:30  a.m.  and  ending  at  5:00  p.m. (excluding a one-half hour (1/2) lunch break) may be utilized if restricted to Long Term Base Crew Employees. With the understanding that this work schedule is utilized to compensate the Employees for hours lost during the twenty-six (26) yearly earned days off (EDO's), in keeping with the terms of the Maintenance Contract with Suncor, Edmonton Refinery, the maximum normal work week shall be forty-five (45) hours beginning Monday at 7:30 a.m. and ending Friday at 5:00 p.m. Of the twenty-six (26) EDO's, eighteen (18) will be scheduled by Suncor and the remaining eight (8) will be designated as flex EDO's to be taken as mutually agreed between the employee and the supervisor.
texts.text: The  parties  to  this  Agreement  agree  that  the  maximum  of  nine  (9)  hours  shall constitute  a  normal  days  work  beginning  at  7:30  a.m.  and  ending  at  5:00  p.m. (excluding a one-half hour (1/2) lunch break) may be utilized if restricted to Long Term Base Crew Employees. With the understanding that this work schedule is utilized to compensate the Employees for hours lost during the twenty-six (26) yearly earned days off (EDO's), in keeping with the terms of the Maintenance Contract with Suncor, Edmonton Refinery, the maximum normal work week shall be forty-five (45) hours beginning Monday at 7:30 a.m. and ending Friday at 5:00 p.m. Of the twenty-six (26) EDO's, eighteen (18) will be scheduled by Suncor and the remaining eight (8) will be designated as flex EDO's to be taken as mutually agreed between the employee and the supervisor.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: It is understood that when an employee is hired with the intentions of an employment term of more than a six (6) week period, that employee will be automatically on the aforementioned Compressed Work Week arrangements and be considered as a Long Term Base Crew Employee.
texts.text: It is understood that when an employee is hired with the intentions of an employment term of more than a six (6) week period, that employee will be automatically on the aforementioned Compressed Work Week arrangements and be considered as a Long Term Base Crew Employee.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Should an employee be terminated prior to working six (6) weeks, an adjustment shall be made in accordance with the terms of Clause b).
texts.text: Should an employee be terminated prior to working six (6) weeks, an adjustment shall be made in accordance with the terms of Clause b).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) It  is  understood  that  when  employees  are  hired  with  the  intentions  of  short-term employment (defined as less than six (6) weeks from the date of hire) that they will be paid in the following manner. During this six (6) week period, employees will be paid time and one-half (1 1/2) for the ninth (9th) hour.
texts.text: It  is  understood  that  when  employees  are  hired  with  the  intentions  of  short-term employment (defined as less than six (6) weeks from the date of hire) that they will be paid in the following manner. During this six (6) week period, employees will be paid time and one-half (1 1/2) for the ninth (9th) hour.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Should the employee be employed onsite after six (6) weeks on the job, that employee will then be considered part of the Long Term Crew and paid in accordance with the Compressed Work Week payment terms (except as outlined in item (e) below).
texts.text: Should the employee be employed onsite after six (6) weeks on the job, that employee will then be considered part of the Long Term Crew and paid in accordance with the Compressed Work Week payment terms (except as outlined in item (e) below).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c) Overtime  payments  for  work  on  the  scheduled  eighteen  (18)  days  off  will  be  at doubletime (2x). If an employee is asked to work their scheduled flex day off without
texts.text: Overtime  payments  for  work  on  the  scheduled  eighteen  (18)  days  off  will  be  at doubletime (2x). If an employee is asked to work their scheduled flex day off without

texts.text: being given forty-eight (48) hours notice, then the employee will be paid overtime at doubletime (2x). Once scheduled, requests for employees to work on flex days will only be made a last resort, after all reasonable options are made to find alternate arrangements.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If a long term employee is terminated without having a flex EDO within the previous six (6) weeks, then an adjustment will be made to pay any regular hours worked in excess of two hundred and forty (240) hours over the previous six (6) weeks at the applicable overtime rate.
texts.text: If a long term employee is terminated without having a flex EDO within the previous six (6) weeks, then an adjustment will be made to pay any regular hours worked in excess of two hundred and forty (240) hours over the previous six (6) weeks at the applicable overtime rate.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d) The employee will provide a minimum of seven (7) days notice when requesting flex. EDO's. Special circumstances will be considered by the supervisor wherein a shorter notice period may be allowed. It is understood that: the onus is on the employee to request the flex EDO's; that these EDO's are over and above the minimum vacation and statutory holiday required by law, and that overtime payment will not be made for flex days not taken by the employee with the exception of those circumstances outlined in items b) and c) above
texts.text: The employee will provide a minimum of seven (7) days notice when requesting flex. EDO's. Special circumstances will be considered by the supervisor wherein a shorter notice period may be allowed. It is understood that: the onus is on the employee to request the flex EDO's; that these EDO's are over and above the minimum vacation and statutory holiday required by law, and that overtime payment will not be made for flex days not taken by the employee with the exception of those circumstances outlined in items b) and c) above

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e) During a period of Plant Shutdown, all employees hired with the intentions of shortterm employment shall be paid based on five (5) eight (8) hour days Monday to Friday or four (4) ten (10) hour days Monday to Thursday and or Tuesday to Friday. Those hired for the Plant Shutdown will continue to receive compensation under the terms of short term employment until the conclusion of the work even if they are on site longer than  six  (6)  weeks.  All  Long  Term  Base  Crew  employees  shall  remain  on  the compensation terms of the Compressed Work Week arrangements where applicable overtime payments will be made for work on a scheduled day off as per Clause c).
texts.text: During a period of Plant Shutdown, all employees hired with the intentions of shortterm employment shall be paid based on five (5) eight (8) hour days Monday to Friday or four (4) ten (10) hour days Monday to Thursday and or Tuesday to Friday. Those hired for the Plant Shutdown will continue to receive compensation under the terms of short term employment until the conclusion of the work even if they are on site longer than  six  (6)  weeks.  All  Long  Term  Base  Crew  employees  shall  remain  on  the compensation terms of the Compressed Work Week arrangements where applicable overtime payments will be made for work on a scheduled day off as per Clause c).

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 2) COKER SHIFT ROTATION
texts.text: 2) COKER SHIFT ROTATION

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The parties  agree  to  "grandfather"  the  current  coker  shift  rotation  that  is  in  place  and operating  at  the  site  under  the  current  arrangements  and  rules.  This  would  apply  to members of Labourers Local 92 currently involved in this rotation.
texts.text: The parties  agree  to  "grandfather"  the  current  coker  shift  rotation  that  is  in  place  and operating  at  the  site  under  the  current  arrangements  and  rules.  This  would  apply  to members of Labourers Local 92 currently involved in this rotation.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Should the Owner require a change to existing arrangements or additional people, the matter will be referred to the Labourers Union and the National Maintenance Council for review and acceptance prior to implementation.
texts.text: Should the Owner require a change to existing arrangements or additional people, the matter will be referred to the Labourers Union and the National Maintenance Council for review and acceptance prior to implementation.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: All other provisions of the Alberta National Maintenance Agreement apply.
texts.text: All other provisions of the Alberta National Maintenance Agreement apply.

texts.orig: 9/80 WORK SCHEDULE
texts.text: 9/80 WORK SCHEDULE

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This work week averages to forty (40) hours straight time over a two-week period and is generally known as  the  9/80  schedule.  It  is  intended  for  on-going  work  and  does  not  operate  in  'major  shutdown' situations.
texts.text: This work week averages to forty (40) hours straight time over a two-week period and is generally known as  the  9/80  schedule.  It  is  intended  for  on-going  work  and  does  not  operate  in  'major  shutdown' situations.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 1) Work week and overtime arrangements will be as follows:
texts.text: 1) Work week and overtime arrangements will be as follows:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The regular work week will consist of four (4) nine (9) hour straight time days Monday to Thursday and one (1) eight (8) hour straight time day on Friday in the first week.
texts.text: The regular work week will consist of four (4) nine (9) hour straight time days Monday to Thursday and one (1) eight (8) hour straight time day on Friday in the first week.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The regular work week will consist of four (4) nine (9) hour straight time days Monday to Thursday in the second week. Friday is a day off.
texts.text: The regular work week will consist of four (4) nine (9) hour straight time days Monday to Thursday in the second week. Friday is a day off.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 2) Overtime on the altered work week schedule will be paid as follows:
texts.text: 2) Overtime on the altered work week schedule will be paid as follows:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Week 1 Time and one half (1 ½) for the first two hours (2) worked before or after the regular nine (9) or eight (8) hours day Monday to Friday-doubletime (2x) will be paid thereafter.
texts.text: Week 1 Time and one half (1 ½) for the first two hours (2) worked before or after the regular nine (9) or eight (8) hours day Monday to Friday-doubletime (2x) will be paid thereafter.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: Week 2 Time and one half (1 ½) for the first ten (10) hours worked on the earned Friday off all other overtime is doubletime (2x).
texts.text: Week 2 Time and one half (1 ½) for the first ten (10) hours worked on the earned Friday off all other overtime is doubletime (2x).

texts.text: In chart form for clarity:

texts.orig: IOL STRATHCONA

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1. Those employees working long-term maintenance at the Imperial Oil Strathcona site will work eight and six tenths (8 .6) hours at straight-time Monday to Friday. The extra six tenths of an hour (.6) each Monday to Friday is designed to compensate the worker for the sixteen (16) scheduled EDO's.
texts.text: Those employees working long-term maintenance at the Imperial Oil Strathcona site will work eight and six tenths (8 .6) hours at straight-time Monday to Friday. The extra six tenths of an hour (.6) each Monday to Friday is designed to compensate the worker for the sixteen (16) scheduled EDO's.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2. All additional hours after the eight and six tenths (8 .6) will be performed at the regular overtime provisions as indicated in the National Maintenance Agreement.
texts.text: All additional hours after the eight and six tenths (8 .6) will be performed at the regular overtime provisions as indicated in the National Maintenance Agreement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3. It  is  understood  that  those  required  to  work  more  than  ten  hours  (10)  on  this  shift  are  entitled  to  an overtime meal break at the ten-hour mark (10) pursuant to the overtime meal provisions in the collective agreement.
texts.text: It  is  understood  that  those  required  to  work  more  than  ten  hours  (10)  on  this  shift  are  entitled  to  an overtime meal break at the ten-hour mark (10) pursuant to the overtime meal provisions in the collective agreement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4. Overtime payments for work on the sixteen (16) scheduled EDO's will be paid at double-time (2x).
texts.text: Overtime payments for work on the sixteen (16) scheduled EDO's will be paid at double-time (2x).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 5. This  schedule  has  been  implemented  to  allow  for  the  harmonization  between  the  Client's  operational personnel and the long-term maintenance workers supplied by Employers signatory to this agreement.
texts.text: This  schedule  has  been  implemented  to  allow  for  the  harmonization  between  the  Client's  operational personnel and the long-term maintenance workers supplied by Employers signatory to this agreement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 6. This work week alteration also ensures that those working long term maintenance are compensated for the sixteen (16) EDO's.
texts.text: This work week alteration also ensures that those working long term maintenance are compensated for the sixteen (16) EDO's.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: RE: SUBSISTENCE ALLOWANCE ASSISTANCE
texts.text: RE: SUBSISTENCE ALLOWANCE ASSISTANCE

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  Parties  hereto  agreed  that  attempts  would  be  made  to  deal  with  employees  requiring assistance in paying for their lodging on subsistence jobs.
texts.text: The  Parties  hereto  agreed  that  attempts  would  be  made  to  deal  with  employees  requiring assistance in paying for their lodging on subsistence jobs.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: It was agreed by the Parties that:
texts.text: It was agreed by the Parties that:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) The employer, where requested by both the employee and the Business Manager of the applicable Local Union, would either:
texts.text: (a) The employer, where requested by both the employee and the Business Manager of the applicable Local Union, would either:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) guarantee or pay for the room with the lodging in place at an amount not to exceed the daily subsistence rate, until the employee receives their first pay cheque or completes the assignment, whichever occurs first.
texts.text: (i) guarantee or pay for the room with the lodging in place at an amount not to exceed the daily subsistence rate, until the employee receives their first pay cheque or completes the assignment, whichever occurs first.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: or:
texts.text: or:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (ii) provide the employee with "an advance", based on the subsistence allowance for the time period stated in (i), which will be deducted from the first pay cheque.
texts.text: (ii) provide the employee with "an advance", based on the subsistence allowance for the time period stated in (i), which will be deducted from the first pay cheque.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) All requests for subsistence advances shall be confirmed in writing by the Local Union Business Manager or their designee at the time of referral.  It is acknowledged that the Business Manager will only make this request where they are aware of a legitimate need for such advances.
texts.text: (b) All requests for subsistence advances shall be confirmed in writing by the Local Union Business Manager or their designee at the time of referral.  It is acknowledged that the Business Manager will only make this request where they are aware of a legitimate need for such advances.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) This arrangement does not apply where a camp is available.
texts.text: (c) This arrangement does not apply where a camp is available.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: It is understood that a request herein shall not be subject to either grievance or arbitration.  The Employer is expected to act in a fashion that meets the intent of this Policy to the best of their ability under the circumstances.
texts.text: It is understood that a request herein shall not be subject to either grievance or arbitration.  The Employer is expected to act in a fashion that meets the intent of this Policy to the best of their ability under the circumstances.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ALBERTA BEREAVEMENT PROTOCOL
texts.text: ALBERTA BEREAVEMENT PROTOCOL

texts.label: text
texts.orig: THE NATIONAL MAINTENANCE COUNCIL FOR CANADA (BEREAVEMENT PROTOCOL)
texts.text: THE NATIONAL MAINTENANCE COUNCIL FOR CANADA (BEREAVEMENT PROTOCOL)

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: PURPOSE
texts.text: PURPOSE

texts.label: text
texts.orig: A group of Alberta contractors and the National Maintenance Council Committee have created a protocol for Alberta NMA Agreement that would allow for bereavement benefits. This protocol is seen to be beneficial in the further growth of the maintenance industry.
texts.text: A group of Alberta contractors and the National Maintenance Council Committee have created a protocol for Alberta NMA Agreement that would allow for bereavement benefits. This protocol is seen to be beneficial in the further growth of the maintenance industry.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ARTICLE I - DEFINITIONS
texts.text: ARTICLE I - DEFINITIONS

texts.label: text
texts.orig: For purposes of Bereavement Pay Benefits set out in Article II below, the following definitions apply:
texts.text: For purposes of Bereavement Pay Benefits set out in Article II below, the following definitions apply:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1.01 'Bereavement Pay Benefits' means the benefits as set out in Article II hereof.
texts.text: 1.01 'Bereavement Pay Benefits' means the benefits as set out in Article II hereof.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1.02 'Child' means a biological or legally adopted child of an Employee, or a stepchild or other child who is or has been dependent upon the Employee for support and who lives or has lived with the Employee in a regular parent-child relationship.
texts.text: 1.02 'Child' means a biological or legally adopted child of an Employee, or a stepchild or other child who is or has been dependent upon the Employee for support and who lives or has lived with the Employee in a regular parent-child relationship.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1.03 'Grandparent' shall mean the parent of an Employee's Parent.
texts.text: 1.03 'Grandparent' shall mean the parent of an Employee's Parent.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1.04 'Employee' means an employee of the Company who at the time of the funeral or  memorial service has been in the continuous employ of the Employer for a period of thirty-six (36) months or longer and who is in good standing with their union, as defined by the Constitution of the applicable affiliated Building Trades Union  and  working  under  the  General  Presidents'  Maintenance  Agreement.  A change  to  the  commercial  contract  whereby  an  individual  is  moved  from  one signatory to another shall not be considered a break in service.
texts.text: 1.04 'Employee' means an employee of the Company who at the time of the funeral or  memorial service has been in the continuous employ of the Employer for a period of thirty-six (36) months or longer and who is in good standing with their union, as defined by the Constitution of the applicable affiliated Building Trades Union  and  working  under  the  General  Presidents'  Maintenance  Agreement.  A change  to  the  commercial  contract  whereby  an  individual  is  moved  from  one signatory to another shall not be considered a break in service.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: January 1, 2026, continuous employment transitions to thirty (30) months
texts.text: January 1, 2026, continuous employment transitions to thirty (30) months

texts.label: text
texts.orig: January 1, 2027, continuous employment transitions to twenty-four (24) months
texts.text: January 1, 2027, continuous employment transitions to twenty-four (24) months

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1.05 'Parent'  means  a  birth  parent  or  legally  adoptive  parent  or  step-parent  and 'Parent-in-law' shall mean the parent of an Employee's Spouse.
texts.text: 1.05 'Parent'  means  a  birth  parent  or  legally  adoptive  parent  or  step-parent  and 'Parent-in-law' shall mean the parent of an Employee's Spouse.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1.06 'Sibling' means a birth sibling or legally adopted brother or sister, step-brother, step-sister, or other person sharing a common parent with an employee.
texts.text: 1.06 'Sibling' means a birth sibling or legally adopted brother or sister, step-brother, step-sister, or other person sharing a common parent with an employee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 1.07 'Spouse' means a husband, wife or same-sex partner by virtue of a religious or civil marriage ceremony, except that a person of the same or opposite sex living
texts.text: 1.07 'Spouse' means a husband, wife or same-sex partner by virtue of a religious or civil marriage ceremony, except that a person of the same or opposite sex living

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ARTICLE II - BEREAVEMENT PAY BENEFITS
texts.text: ARTICLE II - BEREAVEMENT PAY BENEFITS

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2.01 Bereavement Pay Benefits shall be eight (8) hours multiplied by the employees' base wage rate for up to three (3) days of lost work incurred as a result of the employee's attendance at a funeral or memorial service upon the death of an employee's Spouse, Child, Parent, Parent-in-Law, Grandparent or Sibling.
texts.text: 2.01 Bereavement Pay Benefits shall be eight (8) hours multiplied by the employees' base wage rate for up to three (3) days of lost work incurred as a result of the employee's attendance at a funeral or memorial service upon the death of an employee's Spouse, Child, Parent, Parent-in-Law, Grandparent or Sibling.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Bereavement Pay Benefits shall be paid at the straight time rate.
texts.text: Bereavement Pay Benefits shall be paid at the straight time rate.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2.02 Bereavement Pay Benefits shall only be paid to an employee who:
texts.text: 2.02 Bereavement Pay Benefits shall only be paid to an employee who:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) was employed at the time of the funeral or memorial service and was not reimbursed by the Company for lost wages for the days claimed;
texts.text: (a) was employed at the time of the funeral or memorial service and was not reimbursed by the Company for lost wages for the days claimed;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) if  employed  at  the  time  of  the  funeral,  provides  a  completed Application  for  Bereavement  Benefits  form  as  prescribed  by  the Employer.
texts.text: (b) if  employed  at  the  time  of  the  funeral,  provides  a  completed Application  for  Bereavement  Benefits  form  as  prescribed  by  the Employer.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) has  filed  a  claim  for  benefits  on  the  required  form  (Schedule  1) within 60 working days of the death of one of the following persons as defined in Article I: spouse, parent, sibling, grandparent or child.; and
texts.text: (c) has  filed  a  claim  for  benefits  on  the  required  form  (Schedule  1) within 60 working days of the death of one of the following persons as defined in Article I: spouse, parent, sibling, grandparent or child.; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) provides  a  documentation  acceptable  to  the  Employer  which establishes the death of the individual and the relationship of the employee to the deceased within 60 working days of the death. This may include but is not limited to a photocopy of the deceased person's death certificate, death notice, memorial card or obituary.
texts.text: (d) provides  a  documentation  acceptable  to  the  Employer  which establishes the death of the individual and the relationship of the employee to the deceased within 60 working days of the death. This may include but is not limited to a photocopy of the deceased person's death certificate, death notice, memorial card or obituary.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: ARTICLE III - AMENDMENT
texts.text: ARTICLE III - AMENDMENT

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3.01 The parties agree to meet in June 2013 at a time and location determined by mutual agreement to review the experience of the program from implementation to that date and determine if any amendments or adjustments are required.
texts.text: 3.01 The parties agree to meet in June 2013 at a time and location determined by mutual agreement to review the experience of the program from implementation to that date and determine if any amendments or adjustments are required.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3.02 Subsequent to a review, the Protocol may be amended in any respect, from time to time, by agreement of the Parties.
texts.text: 3.02 Subsequent to a review, the Protocol may be amended in any respect, from time to time, by agreement of the Parties.

texts.orig: 4.01 If  any  provision  of  this  Protocol,  or  the  rules  and  regulations  made  pursuant thereto, are held to be illegal or invalid for any reason, such illegality or invalidity shall not affect the remaining portions of this Agreement or the said rules and regulations.
texts.text: 4.01 If  any  provision  of  this  Protocol,  or  the  rules  and  regulations  made  pursuant thereto, are held to be illegal or invalid for any reason, such illegality or invalidity shall not affect the remaining portions of this Agreement or the said rules and regulations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4.02 Wherever the singular and/or masculine and/or neuter is used throughout the Agreement the same shall be construed as meaning the plural and/or feminine or a body corporate where the context or the Parties hereto so require.
texts.text: 4.02 Wherever the singular and/or masculine and/or neuter is used throughout the Agreement the same shall be construed as meaning the plural and/or feminine or a body corporate where the context or the Parties hereto so require.

texts.orig: REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION
texts.text: REQUIRED DOCUMENTATION

texts.label: text
texts.orig: In order to process your application for the Alberta Bereavement Allowance, you must include documents supporting this application including proof of death and relationship to the deceased. If you do not submit the required documents, your application cannot be processed. This may include but is not limited to a copy of the deceased person's death certificate, death notice, memorial card or obituary.
texts.text: In order to process your application for the Alberta Bereavement Allowance, you must include documents supporting this application including proof of death and relationship to the deceased. If you do not submit the required documents, your application cannot be processed. This may include but is not limited to a copy of the deceased person's death certificate, death notice, memorial card or obituary.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: All employee claims must be filed within sixty (60) calendar days of the death. In order to qualify for the  employee  must  have  been  employed  by  the  Employer  for  at  least  thirty-six  (36)  months  of continuous service prior to the date of death and must be employed by the Employer when the death occurs.

texts.orig: 1) The following formula will be used for the determination of Long and Short Term Maintenance Base Rates and Benefits for the duration of the Agreement: January 1, 2025December 31, 2028.
texts.text: The following formula will be used for the determination of Long and Short Term Maintenance Base Rates and Benefits for the duration of the Agreement: January 1, 2025December 31, 2028.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: I) Fort McMurray only:  Maintenance Base Rates will be set at 100% of Construction Base Rates plus 100% of appropriate benefits.
texts.text: Fort McMurray only:  Maintenance Base Rates will be set at 100% of Construction Base Rates plus 100% of appropriate benefits.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: II) Outside of Fort McMurray: Long & Short Term Maintenance Base Rates will be set at $0.75 under Construction Base Rates plus 100% of appropriate benefits.
texts.text: II) Outside of Fort McMurray: Long & Short Term Maintenance Base Rates will be set at $0.75 under Construction Base Rates plus 100% of appropriate benefits.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 2) Apprentice rates are calculated at the percentages provided in the Local Construction Agreement applied to Maintenance Journeyperson Rate.  Appropriate skill premiums to be paid in accordance with past maintenance jobsite practice.  Compressed Work Week Rates will be calculated pursuant to Article 17.000 of the Agreement.
texts.text: Apprentice rates are calculated at the percentages provided in the Local Construction Agreement applied to Maintenance Journeyperson Rate.  Appropriate skill premiums to be paid in accordance with past maintenance jobsite practice.  Compressed Work Week Rates will be calculated pursuant to Article 17.000 of the Agreement.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 3) Benefit Code Calculation:
texts.text: Benefit Code Calculation:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: B Calculated on straight time and overtime hours worked.
texts.text: B Calculated on straight time and overtime hours worked.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: C Calculated on total hours paid.
texts.text: C Calculated on total hours paid.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: D Calculated on total wages.
texts.text: D Calculated on total wages.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: 4) These Wage Schedules are designed as a basic Labour Relations document to demonstrate the formula and approach taken to wage and benefit calculation in the General Presidents' Maintenance Agreement.  EMPLOYERS ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR OPERATING THEIR OWN PAYROLL IN AN ACCURATE AND TIMELY FASHION PURSUANT TO THE COLLECTIVE AGREEMENT WAGE AND BENEFIT FORMULA.  APPROPRIATE UNION DUES DEDUCTIONS ARE TO BE MADE PURSUANT TO THE LOCAL AGREEMENTS.
texts.text: These Wage Schedules are designed as a basic Labour Relations document to demonstrate the formula and approach taken to wage and benefit calculation in the General Presidents' Maintenance Agreement. texts.orig: 6) Employers are responsible for ensuring all employer contributions required for maintenance activities under this agreement are forwarded to the appropriate organization.
texts.text: Employers are responsible for ensuring all employer contributions required for maintenance activities under this agreement are forwarded to the appropriate organization.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: 7) 100% of Appropriate Benefits
texts.text: 7) 100% of Appropriate Benefits

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Parties agree that the application of the 100% of Appropriate Benefits will be based upon the respective Local Union's Construction Reference Agreement. Benefit contributions based on hours earned in construction will be paid on hours earned in maintenance and contributions based on hours worked in construction will be paid on hours worked in maintenance.
texts.text: The Parties agree that the application of the 100% of Appropriate Benefits will be based upon the respective Local Union's Construction Reference Agreement. Benefit contributions based on hours earned in construction will be paid on hours earned in maintenance and contributions based on hours worked in construction will be paid on hours worked in maintenance.
